data.formatted_address: Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Hue Historic Citadel

reviews.text: Extraordinarily beautiful place. Very busy to get in when we went but once one has queued to get in then it swallows people up. Huge scale and very beautiful. Well restored in places but also some ruins are gorgeous. Amazing place. Loved the domestic tourists who dress up as kings and queens for photos. Just brilliant!!!!

We had a fun time exploring this place for almost 2 hours. The whole monument is huge and its best explored without time constraints.

This place beams with the weight of history. The architecture and the royal antiquities are well preserved. You walk at your own leisurely place and explore in depth whatever catches your fancy. There are shops inside the palace selling refreshments and souvenirs too. One of the palace buildings was under construction too.

Very beautiful historical site, you can tell Hue’s restoration budget is being put to good use. There is a lot of area on the grounds with little to no shade so I recommend sunscreen and a hat, they sell water on site for only a small mark up. Recommend going as soon as they open to avoid crowds and heat, although there will still be quite a few people there, there are plenty of side buildings and gardens to explore to escape crowds.

The sheer size of the citadel complex is difficult to express. From the outside it looks reasonably compact but once inside it is a labyrinth of gardens, pagodas, temples and places to be discovered. Give yourself at least 2 hours and ideally 3 or 4 to see everything properly without feeling rushed. Ample places inside to get food/drinks and audio guides were good, if a little pricey (100k)

Beautiful place that is well worth the visit. If you’re in town for a day, this should definitely be checked out.

Lots of culture, history and effort poured into maintaining such an importance part of Vietnam. Word of advice: we visited in mid-April and were scorched by the sun so make sure to carry water (there are cafes here too), sunscreen and sunglasses along with a cap to protect against the sun.

Expect to do lots of walking and reading of the various pieces of history scattered about

data.formatted_address: hồ Tiên, Thủy, CH5H+5CG, Thủy Bằng, Hương Thủy, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Hồ Thuỷ Tiên

reviews.text: It is nice to see, you should add it to your itinerary when visiting the mausoleums close to it. It is doable in 1 hour or less with many great spots to take pictures. Entry without parking is 20k and if you do not come with the scooter you can pay more to be taken closer - or walk 15 minutes - as cars cannot access. The only thing I have to say is I did not expect so many random people, just like any other attraction.

Love this place. Architecture is the dragon is awesome. Kinda creepy since abandoned and all but worth it. Couple minutes hike through a small forest are the slides.

There are gates at the front but our driver just opened in and went through it. Supposed to have guards but I guess not on that day.

Loved seeing this attraction after it appeared a few years ago on social media. Got a Grab taxi there and asked driver if we had to pay the guy who says he is “security”, our driver laughed and said no!!
The guard approached us and tried (in terrible English) to sell us a ride up to the dragon part on motorbike for 30k and he could waive the security fee? Perhaps? IDK he was difficult to understand! He told us it was 2km walk- this is a lie, its about 800m flat walk to dragon. Stick to your guns, don’t pay anyone. Just go in.
We also walked further round the lake to the abandoned swimming pools also. That was cool. The dragon is definitely the coolest part though and the building seemed structurally sound enough to head up into the dragon head.

Paid 10k VND to park the moped. Don’t drive here on moped if you’re inexperienced as the roads aren’t roads but disused paths from the water park and covered in dust and very slippery. Just get a taxi and walk the rest of the way from the barricade, it’s not far. Did meet one selfish couple with their drone but apart from that the place was dead once you got past the Asian tourists getting their photos with the dragon. Head in and walk right to get to the slides and pools. Very weird place! Wear closed shoes as there’s a lot of glass and god knows what on the ground.

Great views from the top! Cool and eery to walk around the abandoned slides and pools. Found some old abandoned huts too.
I didn’t pay any ‘entrance fee’ but I did buy a bottle of water off them so not sure if that was my fee in.
I also heard this place is closing down soon :(

data.formatted_address: 49 Naksan 4-gil, Jongno District, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Ihwa Mural Village

reviews.text: I went in May 2023, and I have to say that it has changed quite a bit. The stairs that were once painted have now been almost completely painted over. So, there might not be as many photo spots as before, but the surrounding atmosphere is still beautiful. You can still enjoy a leisurely walk around the area.

It’s a neighborhood, and street murals are everywhere. I tried to go through even a small alley, trying to find interesting murals. One could spend hours, by checking out small streets/alleys as well as stopping for a cup of coffee in the neighborhood.
Lovely, peaceful walk up the hill, along the city wall and spring trees in bloom, then coffee and hot chocolate and great rooftop views. One of our favourite afternoons in Seoul.

One of my favorite neighborhoods in Seoul. On a weekday morning it is so quiet! You don't get to see any spectacular murals but I find the tiny, quiet and clean streets very charming to wander around. After walking down Naksan Park, getting great views of the city,  having a coffee in one of the very good cafés in the area, do not miss wandering in the narrow streets of Ihwa village to enjoy real Seoul life away from the crowds.

LOVED this area (including the very strenuous, but beautiful, hike up from the Hansung University Station (Exit 4). Supposedly this is an easier incline than starting at  Hyehwa station. I can't imagine how difficult that walk would be compared to Hansung. But in any event it was glorious. I only encountered a handful of people on the trail leading up the mountain and likewise in the village. I can't imagine streams of tourists making it up here given the gazillion of stairs they would have to climb (my friend calls them the Korean stairmaster!). However, if you are healthy, without any major mobility issues, this is a wonderful spot to spend an hour or two exploring. Highly recommend.

data.formatted_address: Ogin-dong, Jongno District, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Inwangsan Mountain Park

reviews.text: impulsively went at 8.00am with my friend - we were greeted by many lovebugs (due to the infestation) and breathtaking views. this hike is definitely beginner friendly so i would definitely recommend this trail. however there are steep areas so wear proper hiking shoes and bring sunscreen, water and bug spray! happy hiking 🍀

Nice respite from Seoul shopping.  Multiple entry points - we went in on the Dongnimmun side and out at Cheongun Park.  Lots of steps but generally not too demanding.  Great views and night view is great.  Bring flashlight if going at night

Scenic mountain and park in the middle of Seoul. The lower section of the park consists of nice, easy, and well-maintained trails through the forest and along the old city walls. To go up the mountain entails walking up a fairly steep grade in a relatively short time, so some level of fitness is required. But it isn't overly difficult, and most of the people I saw doing it weren't even wearing proper hiking shoes. The views of Seoul from the top are, in my opinion, rivaled only from Bukhansan itself (although the views here are from a much closer vantage point than Bukhansan). Definitely recommended

Awesome view from the top and it's free! You can see half of Seoul and Seoul Tower. Trails are easy and well maintained. GPS and mobile data worked throughout the walk. Makes you want to come again and do more hikes!
A nice hike to the top of the park right next to the historical wall. Offers some of the best views of the city as well.

data.formatted_address: 273 Ttukseom-ro, Seongdong-gu, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Seoul Forest Park

reviews.text: Such a healing experience with nature! This is a beautiful park with many different types of plants. The park itself is pretty large and it seems perfect for families! The children’s playground area is HUGE and it has a large climbing structure. There were a lot of hikers, as it was super calming to take a walk around the park. There were a lot of pretty spots, such as a telephone booth area and a gazebo. Additionally, there are many benches and picnic tables as well.

It was such a pleasure walking around and seeing the cherry blossom trees.
The Forest Park is large and has lots of facilities such as sports fields and skateboarding ramps.
It is surrounded by cafes so you can sit down and watch the world go by. There are toilet facilities if you need them and they are clean and easily accessible.
There is also a facility to see butterflies right in the middle.
Highly recommended for a lovely afternoon.

An amazing green belt , a forest train with small
Zoo inside . Very good for spring and autumn as very famous for tulips . Must go and free entry

Very pretty place to see cherry Blossoms.

The park is super huge too, so you can consider spending half a day and have a picnic.

There's even an area where you can try your hand at playing traditional Korean games for free.

It was v crowded when we went on a weekend, so suggest going on weekdays to enjoy the place properly.
I loved this park. It reminded me a little bit of Central Park in New York. I also appreciated how easy it was to get here, and the nearby area with trendy cafes and shops added to the charm.

data.formatted_address: 262 Bogungmun-ro, Seongbuk District, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Bukhansan National Park

reviews.text: One of the most incredible and enjoyable hikes I've had in my life; and I've done many beautiful hikes in Alaska and Germany's black forest. I was fortunate to have someone local with a car take me to the top. It's a pretty long hike to the top so I would definitely recommend getting a ride to the very top instead of trying to start from the train station.

This place is truly amazing! With its strenuous trails and breathtaking views, it's a must for hikers. While it does require some rock climbing, I highly recommend it. I absolutely love this place! Plus, it's very well maintained.

Korean famous national park that is not far from the Seoul City and very accessible through local Metro MRT and bus. It's one the best, well-maintained and equipped tracks with lots of safety (rubber stairs, safety handles, obvious marking over dangerous part and the trails is clearly marked. They also provide rest areas, toilets. There are a few route to choose: easy, advance and expert. Do spare around 5-6 hours for the return trip.

We started on the east side at Bukhansan National Park Baegundae Visitor Center and walk all the way to the top. The path is made of uneven rocks but the hike is ok if you are an average, fit person. I won’t recommend it if you have some health issues. The view at the top is amazing.
We only did the walking trail but it was just beautiful ~~~ we will come back and do a nice hike and hopefully one day reach the top!! Be sure to wear comfortable shoes ~~

data.formatted_address: Nguyễn Đình Chiểu, Phú Hội, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Nguyen Dinh Chieu Walking Street

reviews.text: The best place to admire the Truong Tien bridge, you can come at evening to night, 7pm the bridge light up really nice, come and enjoy your night in Hue city

Good location with lovely Huong River along the street. People can enjoy street foods and listen to music on this street with relatively cheap prices. It is an attractive destination for locals and tourists to go across at the weekends.
It’s a lovely place to walk, especially at sunset. The sellers hounding you to take a boat ride are kind of annoying though.
Great walk by the river at night - safe, well lit, clean, and away from the road noise! Also good for running in the day.

These are walking streets near the bank of the rivers which connect to the night market entrance. These streets offer a magnificent view of the river in the evening, especially with street foods, a cafeteria, and street performances. It is a long stretch of streets along the river with crowded tourists and locals enjoying boat rides and relaxing with some good music from the cafeteria.

data.formatted_address: FH8J+G47, Thuận Hoà, Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Stage of Flag

reviews.text: Not really inspiring. A former bastion used now to house a fairly large flag pole. Makes a good landmark but not a very good tourist attraction.

Cool flag stage, free entry to this area of the citadel. Can walk around the walls and get good views of the surrounding. Visited during summer on a 37C day and the insides of the wall felt like 43C so bring water and be careful to not get heat stroke.
A lot of history.. wonderful experience.. I'm happy that I visited this Temple

This is the front area of imperial palace, full of vietnamese empire histories, it's very dry and hot all year long i guess. Taking local tour guide to hv full explanations of their histories helps recharge your curiosity towards vietnamese past empires.
A large stage of flag, it looks more beautiful from Imperial City.

data.formatted_address: Điện Thái Hòa, Hai Mươi Ba Tháng Tám, Phú Hậu, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Thái Hòa Palace

reviews.text: Very beautiful palace, very interesting architecture, very colorful! There are some exhibition inside, but not many. Interior is very beautiful.

This is a large structure that may have been pretty impressive at one point, and it maybe again. However, right  now it's under restoration and parts of it are covered with tarps and scaffolding with no access for visitors.

This is a very big and wide place where you have to save 1 day or min a half day for a quick tour. Palace was under renovation and other buildings and gardens were also step by step they put in renovation.

The Tai Hoa Palace is part of the Hue Citadel / Hue Imperial City and is a well worth visit when in Hue. Well managed and well maintained buildings and gardens. Situated on the banks of the Perfume River, which allows for a nice outing on one of the Dragon boats if one needs transport from the city centre.

The place is big and the weather was hot. Be ready to walk a lot and sweat. Bring umbrella, wear light clothing and use sunblock. There is a small vehicle that you can rent to go around the palace (but we didnt).

We used motorbike and paid 2k for the parking fee. Thankfully there was no queue at the ticket booth so it was pretty quick.

data.formatted_address: FH9H+9CP, Phú Hậu, Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Đại Nội

reviews.text: If you want to go to only one place in hue that’s the place. I really recommend last hour or last two hours. When we visited all tours were already gone and there were mainly locals in local clothes making photos since light in the afternoon is really beautiful there.
Some places looks spectacular, but overall the attraction felt empty, and my family got too tired from walking. Can’t really recommend it.
If you plan to come, spend a whole day as the palace is massive. Going there? You can imagine what it was like to be a part of the imperial palace. Just a grand experience.

The place requires 200d entrance fee and for 100 more you can get an Audioguide as well. There are many different gates and building and many nice places to take photos. The whole square is huge and you can spent the whole day in there walking around.

This place is Huge! Called the Imperial City, you will enjoy it very much if you are a history buff like myself..! It has tons of pictures from back in the royal ages. Make sure you go early if you want to capture everything. I should have went alone. It is alot of ground to cover but very worth it.

data.formatted_address: Số nhà 19 phòng 203 (Tầng 2, Nguyễn Trường Tộ, Vĩnh Ninh, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế 70010, Vietnam
data.name: Gác Trịnh

reviews.text:
A place full of love, joy, and music. A perfect place to hang out with friends, talk, chat, or enjoy reading a book. If I loved in Hue, this would be my favorite spot to go in the afternoon and read. Definitely recommended for locals and tourists.
Also, the owner and people living/working there are the sweetest ever!!! Great energy, friendship and vibes.

They decorate the coffee shop with impressive paintings (some are surreal that require a deep look from visitors)
It feels like Trinh Cong Son is still alive. His bottles of wine, his letters, his bed, his glasses are there.

This café, in the past, is the residence of the late famous musician Trinh Cong Son, a musician who has made many contributions to the music scene of Vietnam and the world.  The space of the place is nostalgic for the past , airy, with many mementos and paintings about talented musician Trinh.  The place also has many activities to celebrate musician Trinh.  The owner is happy, kind, and the music is melodious.  You leave your car on the other side of the road and walk up the stairs.
Nice decor and tasty drinks. Nice sharing about Vietnamese talented musician Trinh Cong Son.
A place where Trinh used to watch Diem coming back home after school.

data.formatted_address: Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Hue

data.formatted_address: Cầu Đông Ba, thôn Thượng, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế 530000, Vietnam
data.name: Mausoleum of Emperor Tu Duc

reviews.text: Tu Duc is another small complex, part of the massive original Hue Imperial City, which was once the capital and focal point of Vietnam.  If in Hue, then I would strongly suggest visiting here as well, because it is only a short hop away.  It features a snaking canal / moat system, and striking elements that make it very picturesque on its own.  Again, shared with many other temple sites are broken shards of China, integrated into the walls and artwork all around.  I really like this aspect.  I recommend coming here in the AM, because it can get VERY hot in the afternoons here, due to the water, humidity and heat, even during the cooler months.

Gorgeous and interesting mausoleum. Loved that the Emperor lived the Forrest’s before his death. Great place to be interred. Lovely sense of peace. As the Imperial City was busy, this place was quiet.

Nice place to spend a couple of hours.
Some beautiful buildings and landscape.
Not too far from Hue city. Taxis were fairly cheap.
Entrance fee was not too much.
Wasn't busy (end of March).

It was in the combo we bought. It is a bit dar to find but totally worth it.
I can see the difference in mindset, wealth and dedication in how the kings choose to lay
The site closes at around 5:30 so we needed to hurry, but the lake is so peaceful and tranquil

We visited this tomb on a weekday and had an enjoyable time engaging with this place.
The tombs, palace interiors and the royal antiques do a splendid job of transporting you back in time. The palace grounds are huge with plenty of greenery. There are vending machines for dispensing refreshments ranging from 15K-40K vnd depending on the drink.
The interiors were squeaky clean although the tombs’ colours have faded, which is to be expected.
The sunlight and humidity will take a toll on you so pls come in loose clothing amd take a large bottle of water if you don’t want to spend extra on that.

I would recommend this place to get to know more about Hue.

data.formatted_address: CHM8+78R, Thủy Xuân, Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Honour Courtyard

reviews.text: A place steeped in history, quite impressive due to its size and the calm that reigns there. We were almost alone when we arrived in the courtyard where THE royal tomb is located (even if we know that ultimately the king is not buried here but in a secret place). This courtyard is silent, calm, surrounded by trees. It's calming.
Ticket prices are expensive, parking is tight.

data.formatted_address: Chu Văn An, Phú Hội, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Hue Night Walking Street

reviews.text:
Great place to drink and chill at night in Hue.
It is not crowded as BuiVien in Saigon, that's why it will make you feel relax and comfortable.

Loved it, a great jazz piano player working there, he will play if you ask. Great atmosphere, like in your living room. Happy hour until 7pm, Google cocktails. Next door is a burger place and I had the burger here and it was the best burger ever in my life

Nice area to walk around the restaurants and bars (which are trying to out do each other with the loudest music. Some great restaurants and varied food options but perhaps I was expecting more sellers.
The video was from 6:30pm, the photo a bit later on.
Be careful if you stay in the area as we did, I didn't factor in the karaoke bar opposite keeping going until an hour ago, it's 6:30am now.

Fun street, gets loud and raucous and music from different venues clashes where it meets. Weekends you will experience live-band karaoke and disco drag shows on the street. We got there by cyclo, which is a highly recommended way to get around shorter distances and supports a traditional, local mode of transport.

Been here many times but just found a backpacker's favorite street where full of bars, restaurants and shops surrounded by few connecting few streets. Me & my son are literally looking at the street 🥰

data.formatted_address: Unnamed Road, Tx., CGM3+V9F, Hương Hồ, Hương Trà, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Khe Ngang Water Reservoirs

reviews.text: Such a peaceful, beautiful place to come to. We loved it here, just taking in the forests, hills, and lake - absolutely divine.
Go here for a nice ride through some rice fields and enjoying the nice lake.
Good
Beautiful and clean
The lake is clear blue, surrounded by rolling hills and mountains. In the afternoon, watching the sunset is very beautiful. Overnight camping is also great.

data.formatted_address: Hòn Cơn Chà, huyện, 6684+436, Hoà Hiệp Bắc, Liên Chiểu, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Hòn Sơn Trà

reviews.text: Very few people know about the wild landscape
Hon Son Cha or Hon Chao - Hue is very beautiful

data.formatted_address: Thạch Hà, Hà Tĩnh, Vietnam
data.name: Ke Go Nature Reserve

reviews.text: Exquisite!! Peaceful !!  In the midst of nature a big lake surrounded by mountains.
fresh air
One of the must see places in Ha Tinh province.
Beautiful and very big lake which located in the middle of Vietnam. Suitible for travelling, go fishing and sight seeing, camping and outdoor activities. Not crowded, naturally... great place to go.
Very beautiful place.

data.formatted_address: 634F+HHW, TT. Lăng Cô, Phú Lộc, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Secret Waterfall

reviews.text:
We visited this place as part of our Looking Glass Jeep Tour (highly recommended). What a gem!
Unfortunately we didn't have a lot of time so we just had a leisurely drink. However there is food available, supplied by the very friendly locals. A few pools, on different levels, provided some very welcome relief from the heat of the day.
There was some work going on to increase the facilities available. This is being done in the traditional style which blended in well.
Access can be a bit tricky, just a rough track.
The big advantage of this is....no coach loads.
Off the beaten track attraction well worth a visit (but now not so secret 😁)

Water was clear and cold.  Went on a Sunday what a zoo soon many people.  People have built structures all around the river bed and pools so you need to pay to sit down and chill.  There was no waterfall that I could see.  There multiple vendors who have built the shaded areas next to pools and it's so dirty in the surrounding areas.  Make shift huts and kitchens with all thier trash.  Wasn't sure how to go up to the actual waterfall. It was a nice drive there from Da Nang
Off the beaten track, then crossing the river via rocks in the river. Up a stoney, dry river bed and finally to the waterfall. Phew. It was definitely worth the effort.
Lovely quiet place, ideal for a naked swim during a motor tour.
Not so good

data.formatted_address: 9 kiet 66 Lê Lợi, tổ 11, Phú Hội, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế 49000, Vietnam
data.name: Hue Tour

reviews.text:
I booked a very last minute tour with Hue Tours - within 1hour I was picked up and being driven around by a really nice guide. He drove carefully and I felt safe all the time. Mr. Man was really informative and stopped several times to let me take photographs. I really enjoyed the sights and it always makes the day better when you get on with your guide & they know about the history. Would 100% reccomend 🙂
P.S. - he's the guy to book if you want photos at every stop!!!
At the end he even took me to his favourite Iced Tea shop which was amazing 👌

Mr. Nguyen is a fantastic guide. Much better than riding in a big tour bus with lots of tourists. He takes you on his scooter and you get to see everything the way you want to. I highly recommend and when I come back to Hue I will use again!
We had a brilliant time with Bi our guide today on our tour from Hue to Hoi An over the Hai Van Pass. Bi was informative and did his best for us all the time. Thank you so much!

The best tour I've ever had, the guide was truly impressive because he could fluently switch between English and French and super friendly. If I ever return to Hue, I'll definitely book this tour again

We had the best time with the tour guide Teo! We went to a waterfall and swam and marble mountain before arriving safely in Hue. Teo is an amazing driver and I felt very safe and happy the whole time. It was lots of fun!

data.formatted_address: FJ42+W6P, Phú Nhuận, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam

Bt
good

The market sells many and diverse items. The seller is nice, doesn't talk nonsense, doesn't weigh too much.
Most people who go to the market are local people, so it is easy to buy and sell

When I was a student, I lived in Kiet after this market.
The market is very crowded, prices are reasonable and easy to buy. The seller invites enthusiastically.
If you have a place near the market that you like to eat, just go out and buy it. The important thing is whether you have money or not
I love vermicelli mixed with tapioca cake so much

A traditional market that resembles the hearts of ordinary people
A place I visit because the traditional market side dishes are bigger than expected and are delicious.

Myeonmok Market is unfriendly

data.name: Cau Hai Market

reviews.text:
This is the first time to be in Vietnam.
I just joined the kinda activity to visit the local market which's provided by Angsana Lang Co.

Honestly, it's not the market I expected but good experiences.

If you have some curiosities about vietnamese traditional market go ahead.
:)
Commodities are traded a lot, especially seafood. Minus point is handling environmental sanitation and waste is not good at all.
Visited after 30 years from old to new Cầu Hai Market.

They sell a lot of foods

data.formatted_address: Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Ssangmun Station. Ssangmun Station Alley Traditional Market

data.formatted_address: FH9G+PX2, Lê Huân, Phú Hậu, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Hue Imperial City

reviews.text:
The Hue Imperial City is obviously one of the destinations that you must visit when you are in Hue city. The Hue Imperial City is impressively vast, providing a multitude of options for visitors to fully appreciating this remarkable location.

On my recent visit to Hue, I had the opportunity to take a leisurely drive around the Hue Citadel in the evening. Despite the passage of time and the changing visage of the citadel, its enduring solemnity continues to evoke deep emotions in me. Within the secluded confines of the Emperor's palace, thousands of personal stories surely unfolded—those of nobles and servants—perhaps lost to time. The stillness of the surroundings, with its timeless elements such as grass, trees, bricks, pavilions, and palaces, stands as silent witnesses to bygone eras.

If the stones of the Hue Citadel could speak, I often find myself imagining sitting in rapt attention, listening to the tales steeped in centuries of history.

Amazing buildings spread over large area. Whilst gardens need a bit of work there were pockets of beauty. Shop has lovely if a bit pricey things in it. As said before go first thing and there are few tourists.

Currently super hot as no protection in the sun so remember a hat and fan. We loved exploring different parts and probably didn’t see everything. Ended up coming out East side to walk back to the river. 200k to get in- try to see guards at 8am (not sure if every hour)as they were spectacular. Worth going even if under some renovation.

We would have loved to spend more time in the Imperial Hue City.  I would advise at least half a day or a full day to take in all that this fabulous complex offers.  Depending on the time of year, you can find flowers blooming, as we did.  They have coffee shops and restaurants on the grounds so you don't have to pack a lunch.  It can get crowded on weekends.  Must see location if you are a fan of Vietnam history.  The whole compound appears to be a miniature version of the Imperial Palace in Beijing.  It is all preserved well, and the small details are unique.

Had a special visit to this Historic site. Can really feel the ancient history and old school monarch vibes. 200 000k entry feels kind off much as there are a lot of restoration, but I guess you’ll have to see it as a contribution to the end product ;)
We just walked around ourself for 1,5 hour. Took some amazing photos, read what history we could along the way as well as pictured how the Nguyen dynasty had it living here.

Hopefully I return one day to see what this place turns out to be

Hue Imperial City is a testament to Vietnam's proud heritage and must-visit for anyone interested in history, culture, and beauty. The moment I stepped through the gates, I was transported to a bygone era of grandeur and majesty. Ticket was kind expensive for day trip (VND 200,000/per person) Ticket booth is right by the entrance. Weather is so hot.
Tip:
Wear lightweight clothing
Stay hydrated
Bring your umbrella

data.formatted_address: FH9H+3MF, Phú Hậu, Huế, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Meridian Gate

reviews.text: Definitely a must visit when in Huê. This is the main entrance to the forbidden city, and by far the most impressive one. The ticket booths are located right outside of this gate, so you're kind of forced to walk through it. The structure itself appears to be modeled after the imperial citadel's gate of Hanoi, just more elaborate. The wooden buildings above the stone gateway are open to visitors.

For a history buff, it’s a great place to go. The old place grounds are huge and it took us over 4 hours to cover everything and then we still skipped a few.

Food prices are cheap and tend to match the other vendors in the grounds. If not, then just pop along to one of the others.

Just be prepared for a long walk and if you like history. There is plenty to see.

I would also recommend going up to the river defences wall and you can walk along it with the cannon and the flag.

We didn’t get time to walk the old city wall but it looks good with 60’s defences still visible.

The Meridian Gate is the main gate to the Imperial City (purpure forbidden city), located within the citadel of Huế. Constructed in 1833 in the traditional Vietnamese Nguyen style under the rule of emperor Minh Mạng, it was used by the sovereign as an observation point for troop movements and ceremonies. It was modeled after the Meridian Gate of the Forbidden City in Beijing, China. Like the original in Beijing, the Meridian Gate in Huế is composed of a main, central section and two protruding wings, representing que towers, traditional towers marking the entrance of palaces, temples and tombs.

A really well kept historical heart of Vietnam, the entrance to the Citadel of Hue is a place you should not miss if you are in town. Beautiful architecture but the cleanliness of the place needs to be improved here and there, nevertheless it was easy to walk around and you can easily spend > 2 hours here just taking in the sights. The place closes at 5 PM so come latest at 3 PM from this gate as it's better to allocate at least 2 hours to explore the huge ground.

A stunning gate that marks the entrance to the imperial city. Historically significant to Hue, which was the capital of Vietnam from 1802 to 1945. Lots of cool artifacts and photos from the historical times

data.formatted_address: 23 Tống Duy Tân, Phú Hậu, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Hue Monuments Conservation Centre

reviews.author_name: Buôn Ma Thuột Nhà Đất (Thức Hương Khê)
reviews.text: I rode a cyclo around this area at night, the trees were cool and fresh, it was wonderful
The space is very beautiful and airy. Not a tourist attraction, but an office. The gate and office architecture are beautiful and impressive.

We spent more than half a day strolling around this city with its interesting history.  The architecture is beautiful and grand, a mix of Vietnam and China. You will definitely enjoy visiting this ancient city.

When visiting the Hue Citadel, I would like to comment on the following issues. Although small, they cause discomfort for tourists and reflect the manager's poor talent and intelligence.

One is: the current tour ticket price is 200k/person, but when entering, you cannot visit Thai Hoa Palace because it is being demolished due to restoration => so why not reduce the ticket even for guests but sell it for 200k?

Second: Hue ancient capital relics is an important and meaningful heritage in many aspects, like a giant outdoor museum => there should be a tour guide to give a systematic and systematic introduction about this place. and should not be charged. Yet this place still charges a demonstration fee. The amount of 150k is not large, but our way of dealing with history like that is excessive and lacking in education.

Third: electric cars here are charged by the hour, 1 hour is 300k, a car can carry 7 people and still charges 300k. But the tram can't go very far, it just runs around in circles, and can't get close to the nine Gods. Seeing many aunts and uncles trying their best to ride the tram but the tickets were too expensive so they had to walk, made me feel sorry for them. Only families that are well-off can afford to rent an electric car. => Tickets pile up on tickets, squeezing tourists, not serving thoroughly, in the end still "shaping" tourists to the bone. You should review the price of the electric car or the exit route to make it more convenient for passengers.

Fourth: relics are displayed for sale haphazardly inside, some are real but some are fake, losing the solemnity of a big relic => regardless of money, causing a lot of resentment for tourists.

This is my subjective opinion, I hope to receive more constructive feedback.
A unique architectural conservation area that still retains many relics.

Chanh Nam Mon gate is located in the south of Kinh Thanh, at the end of Nguyen Trai street, people still call it Nha Do gate. This gate now only allows one-way traffic from Nguyen Trai Street to Le Duan Street. The arched door was built in 1809, under the reign of King Gia Long, and the upper gazebo was built in the 10th year of Minh Mang, i.e. 1829. Initially, outside the door there was a Statue of Ty, also known as Do. Gia, is a warehouse for storing supplies and weapons. Roughly translated, the two words Do Gia are Do House, so Chanh Nam gate is also called Nha Do gate. The flood in 1953 collapsed the arch and gazebo above Nha Do's door.

Hue So sad
Coming to Hue on a rainy day is even more sad
Far different from my crowded and bustling Da Nang, it has a quiet beauty!
Hue and Da Nang are like a family with two children, one is hyperactive and the other is depressed :))
Just joking, but I still like these two lands. In the near future, Hue will be a very developed place, especially in the field of resort real estate activities!

reviews.text:
I was born and raised in Hue and have heard of Diem Phung Thi for many years. Yet not until I left Hue and came back did I start to research about her and appreciate her arts. The art is indeed very simple but elegant and meaningful, with sculptures and paintings made up of the so-called seven modules, which can form limitless combinations.

The entrance fee is 30.000. The museum is not exactly a spacious place, but I found myself there to admire the art for almost an hour.

A cozy museum with peculiarly charming sculptures. I found myself oddly resonating with the smaller pieces like “Chiến sĩ ra trận vác vợ theo” (Warriors) and “Trìu mến” (Affection). The space itself is simple, welcoming, and unpretentious.

Cute little museum. You can leisurely spend 45-60min here viewing the arts, reading the pieces’ descriptions, checking out the vintage books and magazines collections or just catching a breeze from the poetic window views.

The gatekeeper is very friendly and welcoming.

Treasure artwork for Hue and VietNam!
30k ticket and worthy.

data.formatted_address: Thôn, Kim Sơn, Hương Thủy, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Lebadang Memory Space

reviews.text: Beautiful and very well constructed. Loved his work. Wish more paintings can be sold or printed for purchased at larger size

I got to be in Hue thrice in 2024, and I was very delighted to spend time at Lebadang Memory Space twice. It is not only a celebration of an immense artist coming from and rooting deep within Viet cultural heartland, but also an examination of space-time-human relationship looking through an art-museum model. The space is an art museum, a garden house, an artist residence, a creative hub. The time is contemporary and traditional. The human is not divided. I feel the space becoming more and more of a cultural tissue growing on such a beautiful hill surrounded by the Nguyễn dynasty of Huế.

For my first time there, I was very happy to be greeted by Ms. Hằng, who probably sobbed at some point as she educated me on the artist, his story and his legacy. For my second time, Mr. Kiên shared the same spirit. I am delighted to see everyone working hard to represent the heart of their job.

Until next time,

Hue is so full of history and beauty…this Memory Space enhances ones trip to this beautiful city.  As you walk through the doors you truly feel as if you are in a piece of artwork with the Artist, LeBaDang, gently guiding you along.  Definitely put this on your list of places to visit in Hue.
Having great experience here. Worth to come although the way is quite wild and far.

One of the most beautiful art galleries and gardens that we have seen in Vietnam by far. Everything about the Lebadang Memory Space is exquisite, purposeful and one with nature.  The art gallery’s architecture itself is amazing, the artist and his work are so unbelievably diverse in form and function, yet with a unifying theme. The gardens are amazingly beautiful and serene.  Although one comes to Hue for the ancient city, this modern mini Guggenheim is an experience that will only heighten your image of Hue. Plan to spend a minimum of 1-1 1/2 hours. We wish we had more time. The gallery has two main areas that are air conditioned as well as an indoor cafe. Soon to come is a Homestay where one can enjoy a private evening on the grounds.  Lastly, don’t let the 265k vnd entrance fee concern you; we were a little surprised at first, but it is well worth it.

data.name: Ancient Hue Garden Houses

reviews.text:
Staying at Ancient Hue Garden Houses and French Villas was like stepping into a serene, timeless world where history and luxury coexist in perfect harmony. Nestled within a charming village, this unique property offers not just a place to rest, but an immersive experience that connects you deeply with the culture and heritage of Hue.

From the moment I arrived, I was welcomed by the warm, genuine smiles of the staff, who made me feel like part of their extended family. Their kindness and attention to detail created an atmosphere that was not only comforting but also deeply personal, setting the tone for a truly memorable stay.

During my time at Ancient Hue, I had the pleasure of staying in both Garden House and French villa. The garden house was a beautifully restored retreat, adorned with intricate woodwork and traditional designs that reflected the rich cultural heritage of the area. Each morning, I woke to the gentle sounds of village life and the fragrance of blooming flowers—a serene start to the day that left me feeling refreshed and connected to my surroundings.

The French villa, with its elegant colonial charm, offered a different yet equally enchanting experience. It combined timeless sophistication with modern comforts, adding a new layer of luxury to my stay.

What made my experience truly special was the property’s setting within a vibrant village. Here, I could witness the rhythm of everyday life in Hue. The property itself felt like a peaceful oasis, with lush gardens and spots perfect for reflection and relaxation.

The staff at Ancient Hue went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was not just enjoyable, but unforgettable. They were always ready with friendly words and thoughtful suggestions, whether I wanted to explore the local area, discover hidden culinary gems, or simply unwind in the serene village surroundings.

Staying at Ancient Hue Garden Houses and French Villas wasn’t just a visit—it was an experience that left me with a deeper connection to the culture and people of Hue. It’s a place where i can slow down, savor the beauty around me, and truly feel at home in the heart of Vietnam.

A wonderful eatery in central Hue where you can dine like emperors of a long ago dynasty. The many servings of food are all delicious and the entertainment includes both instruments and song. Ancient Hue House is set in very beautiful grounds. Service is superb and a visit there is highly recommended.

Wow, what an incredible stay at Ancient Huế Garden Houses! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with such warmth and hospitality from the staff. They truly went above and beyond to ensure our comfort throughout our entire stay.

The premises are impeccably kept, with lush greenery and charming traditional architecture at every turn. It felt like stepping into a serene oasis in the heart of Huế. Our room was spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated, offering a perfect blend of modern amenities and traditional charm.

One of the highlights of our stay was definitely the attentiveness of the staff, as well as the breakfast. Each morning, we were treated to a delicious spread of local delicacies and international favorites, all served with care and attention to detail. It was the perfect way to start our days of exploration in Huế.

Overall, we can't say enough good things about Ancient Huế Garden Houses. The staff, the premises, the breakfast—everything exceeded our expectations. We can't wait to come back and experience this slice of paradise again!

As an individual with a keen interest in historical and cultural locations like Hue, I have a profound impression of the “authentic Hue atmosphere” that embraces Ancient Hue Garden Houses and French Villas. The garden house with natural material is not a new concept. However, the distinction between “imitation” and “recreation” lies in the meticulous attention to detail, where every aspect is carefully planned to ensure the balance between “not being too much” and “extremely comfortable and convenient”. The tranquility ambience in the place are subtly but profoundly expressed.

By a few gentle walks through the lust greenery garden, the transition is seamlessly inviting you to different style of French villas lies next by a appealing pool side. The beauty of Indochine architectural style is sophisticatedly manifested in all houses, embracing the premium, luxurious and nostalgia atmosphere. The interior is thoughtfully design with high-quality material and smart arrangement, providing ample space while ensuring your accommodation is convenient and comfort.

The Hue ancient-style restaurant situated above the reception area is a cannot-be-missed place. The restaurant not only offers delight cuisine of Hue but also captures the essence of the city with wooden furniture and unique decorative items, such as a wooden living room set that you won’t see everyday or the Royal Robe in the glass frame. Your experiences will be fulfilled by the exceptional spa treatment, the option of renting royal outfits and dining at a fine French restaurant.

The cost of accommodation ranges from 2.500.000 VND to 9.000.000 VND, and is subjected to change based on season. Additionally, there are various promotional offers available for tourists.

Ancient Hue Garden Houses and French Villas will definitely be my priority choice whenever I visit the city. I highly recommend the place with you and my confidence stays with the thought of your memorable experience to be achieved.

This hotel is amazing. Beautiful, serene, clean and the staff is outstanding. The food is the best we have had in Vietnam and same with the spa. A very special mention to Nie (not sure of the spelling at the reception desk). She was absolutely fantastic. She went over and above anything we asked of her, always patient, happily and kind. I gave the location a 4 only because it’s a ways out of town but that is also a plus.

reviews.text:
The park is stunning but mainly had older people on the occasions that I went. It was still nice and when I was studying Korean on a bench a few of the older women joined me. i still need to explore more of the park which I will do on different days.

There is also a cafe with a great view. I had a cheese toastie with a scoop of chocolate powder on top with a strawberry yoghurt smoothie

Kind of community park at the edge of Seoul. One part is called bunker. One local told me it used to be chemical storage of US military before they moved to Pyeongtaek. Now there are some artist work shops plus couple tanks. I visited on spring Sunday and this park is very colorful with many happy people. It is also the startin point for around Seoul hiking trail. Many foreigners and excellent service from the staff.

It is "Seoul Changpowon". It is a beautiful place where the beauty of iris and the background of Dobongsan and Bukhansan are harmonized throughout the four seasons. The subway station is right next to it, so accessibility is good.

It is a beautiful garden with many flowers and plants. You can see mountains of Seoul here. You can take a walk in the garden and enjoy the greenery. It is very peaceful here. If you want to experience calmness, you need to visit this place.

This park is one of the best places located in Seoul. If you happen to visit Dobong dong area, really like to recommend you to stop by there. Dobong mountain is right in front of the park so you may enjoy this beautiful mountain from the park. And it takes 5 minutes to get from Dobongsan MTR station.

data.formatted_address: 161 Magok-dong, Gangseo-gu, Seoul, South Korea
data.name: Seoul Botanic Park

reviews.text:
Just go
If you’re going to one botanic park in Korea go here! It’s beautiful and exotic!you’ll find plants from various parts of the world. Very well maintained park! You can easily spend 4-5 hrs here. I also went to the new botanic park in Soo Won but it does not compare with this one. I suggest you wear a good layer of sunscreen and bring a sun umbrella for the outdoor garden.

LOCAL: Super easy to find, well organized, there is a large park before the entrance that can be used.
TICKETS: The adult ticket costs 5,000 won, a very affordable price. You need to buy the ticket at the booth, from the electronic machine.
ENTRANCE: You need your ticket to enter the park area and to enter the wooded area. There will be employees helping you.
FOOD: In the park there is a delicious cafe at a good price.
GARDEN: beautiful, cozy, clean and well organized. There are guides if you want. The place has several typical plants from various locations, such as: Brazil, Istanbul, Korea... There are areas that are very stuffy, so don't go with TOO MUCH clothes.
STORE: There is a shop on the top floor, you can find plants, seeds, souvenirs... THE STORE ONLY ACCEPTS CASH, DOESN'T ACCEPT CARD.

Seoul Botanic Park is huuuge. There is an inside and outside area to see. The outside park is free to visit, the inside of the facility too except for the greenhouse, which is 5000₩ per adult, 2000₩ per kid. The whole place is green, colourful and well maintained, with many benches, toilets, there's also a few restaurants. The place offers insight into gardening, recycling, sustainability, and nature overall.

We did not enter inside as it was too close to closing hours, but we absolutely loved the miniature buildings right outside of the entrance. It's such an adorable and detailed design. My wife loved it so much she had to take a photo of almost every single home!!!

I recently visited Seoul Botanic Garden and it was absolutely breathtaking! The garden is filled with a stunning variety of plants and flowers, creating a peaceful and serene atmosphere. The architecture of the greenhouse is impressive and the displays are beautifully curated. It's a perfect place to relax, take a leisurely stroll, and immerse yourself in nature's beauty. Don't forget to bring your camera, as there are plenty of photo-worthy spots to capture memories. Overall, Seoul Botanic Garden is a must-visit for nature lovers and anyone seeking a tranquil escape.

reviews.text: If you’re debating whether you should go or not, go. I actually enjoyed this place a whole lot more than the Mandan tower in terms of the view. It was less crowded, more peaceful and there were so many things to see. Loved the award winning masterpiece by artists. It was like an outdoor museum. Very artsy, peaceful park with stunning view. I would revisit for a relaxing break although out the year. Definitely one of my favorite parks in Seoul.

Pretty awesome park. It's a bit of a hike to get to it, so if you're not keen on that, you can opt to ride the shuttle instead. The place is setup like an instagrammers heaven, with lots of strange setups for fun photos ops. But there's also lots of places to just relax and take in the wonderful view of the city.

Went during Autumn period when there was the silver grass festival. It is a very huge park with many displays to take picture with. There is also free music performance when we went. Many locals there and they are very supportive of the singer, clapping and cheering for him. Good place for picnic. It is advisable to pay for the ride round trip so that you can save your leg power from climbing the long flight of stairs.

Hiked about 300stairs and the view was exquisite!! I really love all the parks in South Korea because most of them is free and offered so much good views to just sit and clear my mind.

Visited this park at dawn nearly closing time and there were literally no people around that time. Such a perfect place to take a breath and enjoy the view.

P.S. This park will look more lovely during autumn season around late Sept to November!

Nature beauty!!! One of attraction place that is not well known to foreingners. Quite easy to reach there by subway and can go back to the city easily by bus. They also provide shuttle bus as cheap as 3000 won round trip. You have an option to walk up the hill. It is a very pretty silver grass field.

data.formatted_address: 6XVQ+GQG, Lộc Tiến, Phú Lộc, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Elephant Springs

reviews.text:
After reading some of these reviews about issues with paying I’m glad it wasn’t just me.
I paid 20k along the road for a ticket to visit the waterfall and when arrived a guy asked if I was swimming and I said no as I had no plan to. I met some people and decided to go in and as I was leaving the man asked me for 20k, which I refused, saying I had paid on the road and he claimed that was just for bike parking.
I know 20k isn’t much but I’ve never heard of having to pay extra to swim at a small waterfall & I asked others there and they said they hadn’t paid for it. Apparently there is somewhere further up the road you can swim for free but not sure if this is true.
The water was very clear and nice and cool, but a real shame about the money grabbers.

Absolutely bizarre place that is nothing like previous reviews. The main area had no stalls or walkways like other photos suggest, we were the only people there. Road to get there was pretty bumpy, entry was through a construction site and cost 60kvd. It seems like the previous tourism has disappeared, no signs of stalls or locals showing you to signs.

However, it was incredibly beautiful, the water was clean and the springs acted like a little water slide. Definitely worth a visit, we went at 3:30pm on a Saturday, maybe it is not always touristy.

Came here 7 years ago and again two days ago after the hai van pass. Pleased to report it’s as stunning as ever and exactly as I remember it. We got recommended a couple other places e.g. Dream Springs but really didn’t like what we saw from recent review photos regarding the shacks and excess tourist effect making it feel ugly.

This place is perfect. My wife and I arrived late on Thursday, around 5pm and were the only ones there. Yes as you arrive you need to pay the security 60k vnd per person but just pay it and enjoy yourself.

The road to the falls feels a little suspicious and is a bit of rough ride but it’s well worth the ride. We were glad to have the security guy accompany us after a short while to reassure us.

The mass tourism effect at these sorts of places appears to move in waves so it felt like we timed this one well, and although we had some safety concerns being alone and suspicious at first (perhaps about getting robbed or worse) we needn’t have worried - although we’d still caution solo travellers, particularly ladies to think twice as it was very quiet, deserted almost.

Had an interesting experience here today. Rolled in with a friend on scooters. 1.3kms away there was a lone security guard standing next to a construction site with no signage requesting us to pay 100k each. We questioned him as it looked suspect. 3 other tourists rolled up on bikes and he had us all stopped. We collectively decided to ignore him and drive through without paying. Further along there was a pay gate. A second security guard had us stopped and was asking us for 80k each. In the meantime the first security guard came up the track on his scooter. They both demanded us to pay them but couldn’t decide on an exact price. One said 80 the other said 60. At this stage we were happy to pay albeit for 1. Wanted to see if the pools were any good and 2 for them to agree on a fixed price. As they wouldn’t let any of us pass to have a look,  I agreed I’d pay them and walk up on foot a further 200m to see if the pools were in swimmable condition to check for the group of 5 of us. The security agreed on 60k. I payed them and I walked up. Came back and gave everyone the all clear that it was worth the 60k. The remaining four payed him 60k. However when I went to jump on my bike to ride it up the track with the others. The security guards said I must not enter. I asked them why and they said to me. ‘NO vietnam!’ And demanded I pay them. I explained to them that I had just payed them the 60k previously.
Either they chose to ignore this or had conveniently forgotten. I rode up the track after one had softened up a little bit and was less aggressive. However at the top Carpark I was greeted by another guard. Who was quite angry. The three of them were convinced I hadn’t payed them and demanded I leave. After trying a few times to explain the circumstances I decided my efforts weren’t getting me anywhere and payed them on an agreed 80k (for a second time.) The pools were worth it. But to cop their attitudes and gaslighting on already much higher prices than other surrounding spots. I’d ask you to make your own judgment on whether you’d like to support their attempt at a 3 tier payment system.
Expect fireworks.
Yours truly.
Vietnam backpacker 🏍️
5 backpackers travelling from da nang to hue, stopped off on the way! would 100% recommend, keep following the path and you will come across it!

data.formatted_address: xã Thủy Bằng, huyện Hương Thuỷ Huế Thua Thien-Hue Province, Thủy Bằng, Hương Thủy, Thừa Thiên Huế 530000, Vietnam
data.name: Mausoleum of Emperor Khai Dinh

reviews.text:
An interesting place to visit.
Although very drab on the outside the inside is stunning with elaborate use of ceramics.
As expected it on the main tourist route and like many places suffers from over tourism hence my 3 star rating.
it's worth getting a guide or read up about the mausoleum

Probably the best looking and most comfortable tomb to visit in Hue. Do not get fooled by the crude appearing exterior. The interior of the main bulding is unique and unforgettable.
The visit is not very time-consuming since tomb of this emperor stands alone (unlike other tombs, this one is not part of bigger complex and it does not occupy a large area).
It is also quite close to the city center and even closer to the abandoned waterpark Ho Thuy Tien.
The ticket for this tomb should cost you 100 000 VND/Person.

You can also buy a combo ticket which allows you to visit multiple tombs within two days for better price. We purchased Combo 4 ticket for 530 000 VND/Person with which you can go to Khai Dinh tomb, Tu Duc tomb complex, Ming Mang tomb and Hue Imperial City.

I also recommend to find out in advance whether any part of the tombs is currently under reconstruction, because for example the temple in Tu Duc tomb complex was not accesible at the moment. So was the temple in the Imperial Citadel. But since the local temples are basically very similar, you don't have to be too disappointed if you have to skip some parts.

Impressive and different from the other tombs, since it utilizes French architectural elements. 150k dong to get in, and definitely worth it. You will have to scale quite a few steps to get to the top, and if it's hot, as it often is in Huê, this may prove a challenging task .

This tomb maybe the smallest but it was the most expensive and it tooj apparently 11 years to finish it.
We went here in the afternoon right after lunch. It was really hot and humid. The good thing is because it was hot, there weren't a lot of people, so easy to get good picture and see the things inside.

Unique architecture. And great view from the top. Worth to visit.

Note: some stairs, but not many. But you need a good health.

data.formatted_address: 373 Bùi Thị Xuân, Phường Đúc, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Ho Quyen

reviews.text:
Former tiger vs. elephant fighting arena. Relocated here after a former emperor was attacked by an tiger at the previous location.
Not too difficult to climb to the top from next to the fence.
A closed "non tourist" site. Fairly easy to locate. Interesting history!

In a distant land, where the sun painted the sky with color and the clouds danced to the rhythm of the wind, there existed a place called the "Hue Tiger Arena." Legend has it that the tigers and elephants of the area engaged in friendly ping-pong tournaments, with the winner being crowned the king of the jungle by the banana queen herself. However, when one of the tigers tried to cheat by substituting the ping-pong ball with a coconut, the elephants decided to form an alliance with the monkeys to defeat the cheater. Since then, the Hue Tiger Arena has been hosting legendary matches where tigers, elephants, and monkeys compete in wild ping-pong games, and the winner may take home the title of King of the Jungle or... a few carefully hidden bananas!

While this story may not be true, when you think about it, it makes the place a little less boring 😅
It's not that spectacular, but it's nice if you pass by. The backstory is quite interesting. Expect to be here for around 10 minutes.

Beautiful old arena and If you watch closely Tiger's claws marks can be seen on the walls.
Sometims its close for the public. So if you are in luck and it is open it is a good place to visit.

data.formatted_address: 6V8V+GFW, Lộc Trì, Phú Lộc, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
data.name: Bạch Mã National Park

reviews.text: Must see Mr Cam who can help call the wild birds for you. If possible, bring high quality camera with long lenses for taking photos pf wildlife. Sunset and sunrise are fabulous. Basic accommodations but the food is great.

It’s great to be here. We spent a night at the old French Villa with no ones else, it was lucky that electricity was cut off that night . We had a so romantic day and night there with candles and no phone or internet. We very much appreciate Bach Ma National Park. We want to come back.

I had a trekking tour here last week, it was wonderful experience, both for the nature and the history about the area, all thanks to the local guide. If you come in the next months (march and april) the rhododendron plants wich the park is full should be blooming.

It is much cooler than at sea level. There was no AC nor a fan in the bedroom,  no need. If you are fit to walk in nature, this is a great place to visit. The hotel restaurant was nice with good Vietnamese dishes and cold beer. The local wine was different and not in our taste. We saw sun rising and sunset, and we were even in the clouds.

The weather here is just perfect!!! Perfect place to go hiking, swimming at waterfall on the way to the top. Beautiful beach view with a lot of protected animal… highly recommended stay a night here at the top, try out local food… will go back for peace and get away from the city

data.formatted_address: 50A Hùng Vương, Phú Nhuận, Thành phố Huế, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Meliá Vinpearl Hue

reviews.text:
Stayed here for a week while visiting family, and man did I get tons of compliments from my folks on this choice of hotel. This does sit at a very high traffic area, but that means you have plenty of options for food & shopping within walking distance.

You can't miss this beautiful building when driving into town, it connects to a mall so you can get things you've missed. Here are some of my hilights:

Check In - great, fast and friendly. You can get a cup of coffee with the shop by desk.
Room: Spacious, clean and modern.
Service: Smells amazing, great room service and amenities.
Food: Breakfast buffet is amazing, tons of options and great staff. Roof top restaurant is great too, dinner is grand due to floor to ceiling wall of marble.

Will definitely stay here again!

Very positive experience and a stunning view from the upper floors.

The breakfast buffet was enormous. Although only a few vegetarian options as standard, we informed the front desk that we were vegetarian and the breakfast manager had 3 more dishes ready just for us, and a choice for the next day too! Amazing service, just let them know.

Recommended paying a little more for the good view rooms as you'll want to see it here! Practically the only tall building in Hue so you can see for miles, unlike similar hotels in more densely constructed cities.

Hands down this is the BEST hotel in Hue. It is the most coveted location and you can spot it from anywhere in Hue.

The rooms are beautiful and the views are to die for. BEST Sky Bar not just in Hue but all of Vietnam. We stayed for my birthday and they made it extra special. The pool is amazing!

This place, is just AMAZING! I couldn’t thank the staff enough, they are lovely and always helpful and accommodating, they even arranged our motorcycle rental
Upon check in.

The room, is just super nice spacious and clean all the time, room service is good too and the cleaning staff is always on time.

They made our trip in Hue extra special
The breakfast buffet is on point.

Melia Hue! Thank you so much, we are coming back!!

Pros: Great location. Great selection for the buffet. Amazing gym. Amazing service and hospitality from the staff! We were especially impressed by the concierge who helped us during our check out (20 May, around 7 AM). Our room was with a spectacular view of Hue, and the shower is great.

Cons: Underneath the beds is a bit dirty - we found slippers from previous guests there. If there's an event next door (I.e. Vincom), you can hear it all from your room. Luckily the event ended early enough for us to sleep.

data.formatted_address: 3005 Silver Creek Rd STE 190, San Jose, CA 95121, USA
data.name: HUE Restaurant

reviews.text:
Very popular Vietnamese restaurant. They have a variety of appetizers to choose from. A lot of them  are made of sticky rice and seafood and tastes like mochi. Mi Quang is made of turmeric noodle. And pho is also very good.
You need to wait in lines on weekend as they  are too popular.
The plaza has plenty of parking space. However, it is still difficult to find parking on weekends.

Myfavor place to have vienamese tapas. Besides bun Bo hue, there are so much impressive dishes.

There rice noodle texture is so good, very fresh~

The green been egg crepe and  Bánh Beo are amazing.

The drinks are also good, get the combination. yummy!

Nice seating and fast service.
Really good food. Service was quick and attentive. Amazing bun bo hue. Would recommend the appetizer dish #1 and #2

Overall I really liked the food.
My wife had shrimp vermicelli and I had vegetable spicy noodle soup!

The shrimp vermicelli was served cold (as expected) and the veg spicy noodle soup was hot!

I really enjoyed the veg dish it had fried tofu, soy bean cake (taste like smoky meat). And the portion was much more compared to the price point.

I also had Vietnamese cold coffee (with condensed milk) which was a treat to have!
My wife also enjoyed the food!
Overall I really recommend this place!
Got my BBH and banh beo fix here! Viet food in San Jose is still way better than the rest of the bay.

data.formatted_address: H.NO.344/3 S.NO.94, 11, Candolim Rd, Saipem, Marra, Goa 403114, India
data.name: HUE GUH The Porto Candolim

reviews.text:
We had an amazing stay at HUE GUH in Goa! The hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. The owner was incredibly kind and welcoming, making us feel right at home from the moment we arrived.

The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated, with all the amenities we needed. The hotel's location was perfect, with stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. They helped us plan our days, recommending the best local spots and activities.

We only stayed for 2 days, but we felt so relaxed and rejuvenated. We can't wait to come back and experience the warmth and hospitality of HUE GUH again.

Wonderful Stay at The Porto Candolim

My stay at The Porto Candolim was nothing short of exceptional. The hotel offered a perfect blend of comfort, luxury, and hospitality.

The rooms were spacious and beautifully designed, with modern amenities that ensured a comfortable stay throughout.

The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, always ready to assist with a smile. Special mention to the front desk for their prompt service and helpful local tips that made our Goa exploration seamless.

The dining experience at the hotel was delightful. The breakfast spread was extensive, offering a variety of delicious options to start the day.

The Porto Candolim's location was perfect for us - away from the hustle and bustle yet close enough to explore the vibrant attractions of North Goa. The swimming pool was a refreshing retreat after a day of sightseeing.

In conclusion, The Porto Candolim exceeded my expectations in every way possible. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Goa, whether for a relaxing getaway or an adventurous holiday

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hue Guh Hotel, and I must say it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. From the moment I walked through the doors, I was greeted with warmth and genuine hospitality that set the tone for an unforgettable stay.

The attention to detail in every aspect of the hotel is truly commendable. The lobby exudes elegance, with tasteful decor and a welcoming ambiance. The check-in process was seamless, and the staff was not only professional but also friendly, making me feel like a valued guest from the get-go.

We enjoyed a lot here, very kindly all staff and service is also very good.
Food quality is also very good.
I highly recommend this best place for stay in north goa

Unforgettable Stay!

Our stay at HUE GUH The Porto Candolim was absolutely amazing. Located in a prime spot, the hotel is perfectly cut off from the bustling North Goa crowds, offering a serene retreat while being just a 10-minute drive from the beaches and markets. Perfect balance of peaceful surroundings and convenience!

From the moment we arrived, the hospitality was spot-on. We were greeted with a welcome drink and, after a swift check-in, were escorted to our rooms.

The rooms were luxurious, meeting 5-star standards in every aspect. The bathrooms featured high-end Kimirica products, adding to the sense of indulgence.

The staff was incredibly attentive and always ready to assist with a smile. Special thanks to Suja and Mary for their outstanding service.

A heartfelt thanks to Saurabh, who went out of his way to make our stay unforgettable. He personally checked with us about our food preferences and instructed the in-house chef to whip up some amazing prawn curry and king fish curry for lunch—just the comfort food we were looking for! Every detail, from the food presentation, to the way the salad was cut and the choice of cutlery, showed personal attention had been paid, which truly stood out. For breakfast, we enjoyed aloo puri that reminded us of home and some lovely egg preparations with the perfectly made adrak ki chai - rare to find in Goa!

The hotel has a very positive vibe, making for a relaxed and enjoyable experience. A special shout-out to Sandeep, the in-house cab driver, who made our travels around Goa stress-free.

HUE GUH The Porto Candolim has now become our go-to destination whenever we visit Goa. Each and every staff member goes above and beyond to ensure that the guests have a "happy vacation," true to their name. We highly recommend this hotel to families, friends, and couples looking for a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and exceptional service. Thank you for making our stay so memorable!

data.formatted_address: 754 Seogot-ro, Dangha-dong, Seo-gu, Incheon, South Korea
data.name: Emart

reviews.text: Typical larger Korean combined supermarket and department store with wide range of local and international goods and products. Live seafood to large electrical white goods and everything inbetween. Arranged over three floors - basement for food and some household/beauty/personal products, ground for clothes, cosmetics etc, first floor for electrical, sports, toys, diy, camping, and other household. Multi story car park on site. Adjacent to subway. Foreigner visitors can claim instant VAT refund at customer services.

Stop It. Those of you using Google Translator have such terrible Korean. you sound like a bunch retards head bunting each other. Do you realize Google translator takes context as well as literal? Most Koreans study English in Elementry, middle school, HS and college. So if you cant, when did you finish school???
Pretty much a place you can get almost anything you want. As its a hyper market. Unfortunately they dont speak english, so if you don't speak korean it will be hard to get assistance.
Very good and located right by buses and subway. Great range as expected at all Emarts. Parking is also plentiful.
It's an eMart. You will find anything you want except some that it dose not have.

data.formatted_address: 8H82+498, Dương Hoà, Hương Thủy, Thừa Thiên Huế, Vietnam
data.name: Chin Chang waterfall

reviews.text: Lovely place to cool down about 50 min drive away from hue. Be wary of the last 2 km though, it might take advanced driving skill. In case the owners of the place read this, we visited you on last week when the place was deserted. You took some photos of us that we would like to obtain as well. Thanks in advance and see you in the future!

Nice waterfalls, not that big though. To get here you follow the signs (see my picture) and then there are other signs, red text on white board.
Mainly you follow the main road until you reach the construction site, which you pass through and behind it the water starts to churn. To get there on motorbike requires advanced driving skills. We parked the motorbike about 2km before and finished it walking.

Pretty good. Only paid 7,000 for parking. Place has some bathrooms, squat pots, beers are 15,000. The last 2-3km of the drive is a dirt road with loads of rocks and dips - pretty fun.

Edit - a week later and beers are 20,000 now...
OK

The waterfall is still wild, with nine small waterfalls. Below the waterfall, there is a long stream with abundant and deep water that does not need to be blocked by rocks. When bathing, you need to be more careful. Food is also good (eg grilled chicken 280k/chicken - 2020). The road to the last 2 km is a rough dirt road, very difficult to go and a bit narrow, a car of 30 people can get in, but if you encounter vehicles coming from the opposite direction, avoid hardship.

data.name: Bồ Ghè waterfall

reviews.text: After driving 10+ min on our scooter on the bumpy road we came at a gate where they ask 50 kd per person to enter. I'm always a little bit sceptical about paying money to these people (no official price or ticket office). Especially after reading all the bad reviews. I wanted to negotiate but these people started being agressieve and laughing with us. In the meanwhile around 8 people drove trough without paying. We drove away because of this childish behavior. Get these people away from here if you want more tourists to come here!

Paid entry at the gates , drove to the waterfall and we were demanded to pay 250000 vnd by the locals there , we said no that’s too much and they told us to go away and leave. So I wouldn’t bother going
We were there for two hours and didn't see any tourists. Really relaxing, nice place for a swim.

Really nice spot, very quiet, only a few local tourists here. The guy on the gate tried to make us pay 50 each when the price is supposed to be 10 each, ask to see the ticket, it has the price written on it. We sat down under a shaded bar, cheep drinks and the food looked and smelt great. Only downer was when we left they wanted us to pay for sitting down even though we had bought drinks, they did not tell us when we sat down we had to pay to be there

Definitely abandoned but still operated by 2 nice ladies who live there and will ask you to pay for parking and entry to swim in the spring. Still beautiful but be prepared for an interesting, off the beaten path type of experience if you plan on going here. I think we paid 10000vnd for parking, one of the ladies also had a karaoke machine if you are into that. Beware of the roads getting into here, very old and broken.

So much potential here for a beautiful beach. Maybe it was the tide, maybe the area we went. The country as a whole has a bad relationship with the environment,  unlike thailand where places like this are kept clean here is another story.  One day I hope this changes for the better.  Really highlights the issue of plastic waste.
The beach is surrounded by private properties, so to visit, you have to go through the road of a resort. But the road to get there is beautiful.

Beautiful sandy beach with very clean waters. But very shallow. The locals & the tourists could preserve it a bit cleaner though. The restaurants are decent with fresh seafood of course, but their showers & their wc are a pretty bad experience I'd prefer to forget.

reviews.text:
We saw it the first on a perfume River cruise to the Thien Mu Pogoda. Then again when we visited the Citadel.

It is the largest flagpole in Viet Nam, 120 feet. Originally erected in 1807, destroyed by a typhoon in 1904 , rebuilt to be destroyed again  in 1947 and finally rebuilt in 1948.
Cool big flag to hang over the area! Helps you navigate inside the citadel
Famous place to visit
A must take photo! Sunny afternoon is the best time for the photo. Many people exercising/running/kids playing in the evening
Posting this for the Independence day of Vietnam. This is a wonderful place to see day and night…

Good intro into the life of this very interesting person but not too well setup or structured (comparing to other museums we've been to).

The museum is quiet, plenty of space, and easy to get to.  The displays of Ho Chi Minh's life  are comprehensive.
